reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Minerva was a fantastic place to stay and a wonderful experience. We stayed for four days celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary and could not have had a better time. We were greeted with a bottle of champagne in our room and the room was fantastic. We had a seaview with a balcony and the view was incredible. We sat outside to have our breakfast - which was delivered free of charge through room service. What a treat to drink cappacino and gaze at the beautiful Bay of Naples. The staff were all friendly and informative. The walk to town was easy both ways - even with a bad knee. Breakfast was very good - we ate all other meals in town. Caruso's for dinner was excellent and so much fun. We are looking forward to staying here again - maybe for our 21st anniversary. We can't wait.
reviews.title: Fantastic Minerva

reviews.title: We Will Be Back With Mea !!!!
Lovely Hotel, Terrific Town
reviews.text: We spent five days at the Minerva in late April and early May. What a nice hotel, and the setting can't be beat! The hotel is built into the cliff, and offers a fabulous view of both the town and the Bay of Naples looking toward Mt. Vesuvius. The public areas of the hotel are very nice, especially the extensive 5th floor deck that includes breakfast and dinner seating. Our room, a triple with balcony, was both spacious and comfortable. The hotel is a short walk from the main shopping/tourist area of Sorrento -- though the sidewalk is very narrow in places for the number of walkers and the traffic kind of crazy. Sorrento itself offers a large number of good restaurants (Antica Trattoria was especially fine, with great, friendly service and an upscale atmosphere) and fun shopping, especially in the narrow alleys of the old town. Be prepared for a bit of hiking, though, if you go to either Marina Grande ( the fishing village) or Marina Piccolo (where the ferries to Capri and Naples dock) -- most of the town is at the top of the cliff so the walking is pretty steep to and from both. Of course, the more you walk, the more gelato you can eat -- we especially liked the first gelato/sandwich shop on the main street on the right as you come into town from the hotel.

reviews.title: Our Room with a View!
reviews.text: Hotel Minerva exceeded our expectations. We had a third floor balcony room and in every sense of the word, our view was breathtaking. The hotel itself is quaint, with beautiful mosaic flooring thoughout. The public rooms face the bay, so wherever you are in the hotel you are greeted with outstanding views of Mt. Vesuvius. There is an expansive patio that extends along the fifth floor of the hotel with a small reflecting pool and lots of seating to enjoy the warm Sorrento sun. Our room was spacious and comfortable. The breakfast was plentiful and the staff very accomodating and friendly.

reviews.title: The perfect view
reviews.text: We walked into town from the hotel and although the climb back from town is steep, we enjoyed the exhilerating hikes, especially after a delicious dinner in Sorrento. There is a bus stop directly across from the hotel if the treks to and from town seem a bit daunting. Our most memorable day trips were the winding bus trip to Ravello and the train trip to Pompeii. Sorrento itself is a wonderful town to explore and we could not have asked for a more pleasant stay than the one we had at Hotel Minerva.

reviews.title: Stay at this hotel!
reviews.text: This is my second time staying at Hotel Minerva and it was just as perfect as I remembered it. A beautiful cliff/sea view. As soon as we checked into our room the concierge brought strawberries and champange as they noted on my passport that my birthday was two days away. (and we were not charged for it) We had a quad room with four adults and had plenty of room. Clean big rooms with a big bathroom. Breakfast was great as well as dinner at the hotel. The hotel even had someone come to our room to give us pedicures for only 10 euro each! Concierge was extremely helpful the entire time. We booked our room by email and every time I emailed a question they were prompt to answer. I would definitely stay there a 3rd time and cannot wait to go back!

reviews.title: Ist class Minerva Hotel
reviews.text: Note: if you are traveling by train, you have to take a train to Naples, then you have the option of paying 80 euros to have a driver bring you to Sorrento or you can take another train into Sorrento. We have chosen to take the train because it was only a few dollars but did not like it. We felt like sardines all packed together, no AC for 70 minutes and the entire time we had to stand with our luggage. A littly sketchy but we did arrive safely. Next time we are getting a driver.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: We travelled as a family with 4 young kids and we had a brilliant experience.We explained to the management before we arrived what our needs were ie large room and balcony and they surpassed our expectation.The staff were very kind and understanding of our kids and we always felt that nothing was to much trouble.The views were spectacular and the food was of a high quality.We intend to return next summer and are already looking forward to sitting on the terraced balcony with a drink in hand taking in the magnificent sights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We returned to the Minerva Hotel for a second fortnightly stay in September. The first time was in September 2004 when we had an excellent stay so it seemed the natural thing to return there as we were staying in Sorrento. We found all the staff friendly and helpful, we enjoyed the meals and the Wednesday evening entertainment was not to be missed. The room and the view of the Bay of Naples from the balcony were excellent. Unfortunately I was unwell for the first few days we were there (nothing to do with the hotel), I hurt my back stepping awkwardly of a curb in town, and all the staff were very helpful and concerned about my welfare. When we return in the future I am looking forward to dancing the twist with the reception staff. Once again we had another wonderful time in Sorrento going to Capri, Naples, Pompeii, the Amalfi coastline. The holiday was made all the better by staying at the Minertva Hotel. Many thanks to all the staff there.
reviews.title: Fantastic view, poor accommodation, poor food, poor service
unforgettable
reviews.text: In OctoberI had my second holiday in Italy and luckely I chose the Hotel Minerva for it! It is the dream of any traveller: perfect location(from the terraces you can see the Vesuvio and the bay of Napoli), excellent food, wonderful staff,very nice and relaxing atmosphere. It was so nice to wake up in the morning,open the window and see the beautiful scenary of thesea and mountains around us! The satff is very helpful indeed, I still want to thank the reception desk for the good suggestions they gave us for trips and restaurants ,thanks againg for answering all my questions(they were really a lot), but the location is so nice that I wanted to know everything about it! I 've read someone complaining about "my" hotel: they must be foolish! we booked and payed for a room facing the sea, and we got it; how can you complain for not getting something if you didn't book for it? My suggestion? Book a room in the Hotel Minerva requesting and abvioyusly paying the sea view and the terrace if you wish, and you'll have an unforgettable holiday!!

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Staff and views
reviews.text: I have just returned from the hotel Minerva after a weeks holiday with my partner. The hotel is lovely, tthe staff are very friendly(especially the waiters and bar staff) and helpful and the rooms clean. The food was excellant both breakfast and evening meal and the views over the bay of naples great even when the weather is not so good (as it wasnt for one of the evenings during our stay). Sorrento is a busy village which has a great feel especially at night. Capri, Amalifi and Pompei are only short distances away. Would definately return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Minerva from 6 – 13 October. The views are spectacular, and the hotel very clean with a lovely old world charm. Unlike other reviewers, we had no problem with the room allocated to us, and therefore no reason to antagonise the front desk. A sea view and balcony (some are bigger than others) are a must. The table service was first class, although after speaking to fellow travellers during our 8-hour delay at Naples airport (Thomsonfly), this is common to all Sorrento hotels and not unusual. I heard many glowing reports of other hotels that had been chosen via the ‘stick the pin in the brochure method’ – so I sometimes wonder why I stress for hours researching these places!
reviews.title: Shame about the food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: However, if you can’t resist other people’s opinions - the problem with the Minerva really is the food, especially the evening meal (unless you enjoy Campbell’s cream of chicken soup followed by an uninspiring meat, potato and soggy veg). Something you would expect from a 2-star. The restaurant is gloomily lit and adds nothing to the experience. One lady told the head waiter that she would like to take the chef home – I hope he didn’t hear my husband shriek “Wwwwwhat!!!??” in disbelief. She should have been given a can-opener. The weather was still warm enough to breakfast on the terrace, which detracted somewhat from the continental fare (which actually wasn’t too bad).
reviews.title: Minerva, best hotel in town!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The daily walk to and from the Sorrento restaurants, in the dark, along a busy noisy road was not something we looked forward to after a day on our knees around Pompeii, Herculaneum, Vesuvius and Capri, and also an unnecessary additional expense. My best advice is to get to know the bus timetable early in your holiday if you decide to stay here and eat out. Returning to the hotel, the orange bus ‘A’ with a red line down the side to Capo de Sorrento leaves the main Tasso square (from the bridge over the ravine) every 20 minutes and drops you outside the hotel – cost one Euro. The hotel or tabacconists sell tickets. A taxi from one of the marinas cost us nearly 18 Euros….. Don't write off an out of town hotel that runs a shuttle bus - you might be glad of the tranquility.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I agree with Ms. Crumlin. We had a similar experience. I booked our reservations in Jan. for a Sept. trip, paying the highest amount available thru Expedia. When we arrived, we were stuck in a room without a terrace, which I specifically requested, stating it was our anniversary trip. The reception desk snottily stated that "Madam, you did not pay for a terrace" and refused to move us. Since internet access was spotty, I was not able to confirm what we paid until I got home. We got a nice view from a window while others around us enjoyed their terraces immensely...heard them partying til wee hours of the night outside our windows. Reception desk was not friendly after that...I never felt comfortable even asking for information on tours. The general attitude is as if "we" were there to serve them and not the other way around. I agree that the common terraces and dining halls are beautiful with a marvelous view. This place has so much potential but they HAVE TO beef up the rooms (they look too old and musty) and step up their service. Our cable TV was stuck on one channel and movies did not work. We called front desk. They sent the porter but he could not make it work. Worst part of our 16 day trip that started in Rome. It put my husband and I in a rotten mood and changed the whole trip for us. We ended up just walking to the city limits most days which is really nice. The exception are the fabulously charming waiter (Antonini) and bartender (Antonio). These guys know SERVICE. If you're going to Sorrento, better stay elsewhere! We picked Sorrento from reviews off this site, but I guess you better not have a room problem or they will TURN ON YOU! Give your business to someone else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Hotel Minerva is a great place to stay if you plan to visit the Amalfi coast. I loved Sorrento as a base, not as expensive as Positano but still with all the charm and magnificent views. Minerva is about a kilometre from the city centre but this is an advantage not disadvantage. The restaurants come to pick you up to drive you into town and drop you back and you are away from the hussel and bustle or should I say chaos of the town centre. We stayed on the 6th floor and has a spectacular panoromic viw of Sorrento. It is clean, neat, has a safe, nice bathroom and comfy beds. The staff can book tours etc for you and the restaurant recommendations turned out to be good too. Overall, a lovely place to stay in Sorrento.
reviews.title: A must if you're staying in Sorrento
